data.title: Set AllowUserResizing as virtual
data.body: I was gonna submit some new features to the `GameWindow`, but then I noticed how broken it is... there are a lot of things I will need to improve before I can implement anything properly. The last PR I submit regarding the `GameWindow` stuff will contain documentation and `Obsolete` attributes (and probably some code formatting fixes).

data.title: Support DistanceScale and DopplerFactor under OpenAL
data.body:
Fixes #5717 

I haven't tested this yet.

data.title: SoundEffect.DistanceScale does not work under OpenAL
data.body:
The `SoundEffect.DistanceScale` global is correctly set under XAudio platforms:

https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Audio/SoundEffectInstance.XAudio.cs#L41

But it is totally unused under OpenAL:

https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Audio/SoundEffectInstance.OpenAL.cs#L72

This breaks games causing sounds to be too loud or totally silent.

data.title: Type.GetTypeInfo() is Net 4.5+
data.body:
I just noticed that ```Type.GetTypeInfo()``` is an extension method only present since .Net 4.5.

This change breaks the compatibility with .Net 4.0: https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/commit/e3261f71c780c7b8294a42a9e3f36efd447f439d#diff-51a9663b2b82c89eb208960d5902e904R38

Having a .Net 4.0 compatibility is interesting for Windows XP support.

According to the Steam hardware survey, Windows XP still represents about 1% of players. http://store.steampowered.com/hwsurvey/

Is this something we should care about or should we move forward?

I would be fine with moving forward, since Microsoft doesn't support the OS anymore and that the OpenGL 3.0 requirement for DesktopGL represents a way bigger barrier (most XP machines don't even support it anyway).

@tomspilman @KonajuGames @cra0zy

data.title: Update NuGet packages
data.body:
Stuff done:
 - Fixed author, owner, copyright, description, summary and licenseUrl properties
 - Included .targets file for each platform to supply MonoGamePlatform property
 - Removed readme.txt file
 - Some code formating (my text editor had done it automatically... forgot to disable it, but it looks way better now so I kept it...)

data.title: Reusable function for raising events
data.body:
Before raising an event, you must first check the handler to see if it is null in order to check that an object is subscribed to handle the event.  This is best done if the event handler is stored in a local variable just in case the last subscriber unsubscribes in a different thread between the time the event handler is checked and the handler is actually invoked.  This reusable function makes it easy to raise events by storing a local copy of the handler and checking for null before invoking it.  Many classes already had a helper function for this.  This change refactors those into a single function.

There are some instances where more complex logic was being done after the event handler was checked.  In those scenarios, the code was mostly left alone except for the introduction of a local handler variable.

data.title: Fixes to Texture2D.FromStream on Windows DirectX
data.body:
This PR fixes two bugs in Texture2D.FromStream() under Windows DirectX.

First is that it was premultiplying the color data on load which XNA does not do.

Second XNA blacks out the color data on any pixel with zero alpha.

I added two unit tests to verify this fix.

Fixes https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/issues/5529.
Fixes https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/issues/4820.

data.title: Is touch working correctly on MonoGame for Windows Desktop?
data.body:
Could anyone with a windows touchscreen say if latest MonoGame Windows version is working correctly for touch?

For me, the touches collection provided by TouchPanel.GetState(); 
returns a collection that keeps accruing more touches in it as a game session goes on.
It looks like old touches are never removed.

I tried applying the fixes from here:
https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/pull/5518
But that did not fix it for me. 

I'm using a modified version of MonoGame but one  which incorporates all the recent commits.
So I'm wondering if this is just broken in our branch, or is this not working for everyone?

data.title: Mac build fix
data.body:
This PR has a critical fix to make MacOS build again.

Also fixed a small documentation typo.

data.title: RPC curves are now updated before Cue is played
data.body: This PR fixes XAct to ensure RPC curve values are updated before a cue us played.

data.title: Lets talk about DesktopGL
data.body:
I was gonna talk about this in #3831 but that become too crowded.... anyway, right now DesktopGL is still split into WindowsGL and Linux projects, while we only use binaries from one of those and package it into DesktopGL stuff. Right now there are 4 possibilities, either we:
 1. Merge the projects into one, tho that might create a bit of problem for the Pipeline Tool since it resides in main platform projects
 2. Keep stuff as they are
 3. Add a DesktopGL platform, use it for NuGet and keep the rest as is
 4. Add a DesktopGL and MacGL platforms to source, add WindowsGL, MacGL, LinuxGL nuget packages and make sure that each platforms package only provides the needed native libs for that platform (bonus we can hardcode libs so there is no config file, solves 1 of the problems we have for .net core support)

CC. @tomspilman @hach-que

data.title: Missing NVTT.DLL with Pipeline tool and fresh VS2017
data.body:
I had an issue with my Win10 install and had to do a reset which cleaned out the OS and removed all the apps.

I re-installed VS2017 and Monogame. When trying to build my project, I am now getting the following error in the pipeline tool when processing an fbx:

Processor 'TextureProcessor' had unexpected failure!
System.DllNotFoundException: Unable to load dll 'nvtt': The specified module could not be found.

Any ideas what I need to install to get nvtt? I googled it, but can't seem to find which library / package nvtt comes with.

FYI, I am running build 3.7.0.347

Thanks.

data.title: Mouse horizontal scroll wheel value
data.body: We currently have access to cumulative vertical scroll wheel value through `Mouse.GetState().ScrollWheelValue`, but the horizontal one isn't available. It could be useful to have access to it on macOS where such a gesture is quite common.

data.title: Implemented cached staging buffer for D3D vertex buffer.
data.body: The creation of the staging buffer was moved into it's own function because it previously appeared twice in the file. This makes for DRYer code.

data.title: Implemented caching of staging resources used to copy data from a Texture2D under DirectX
InvalidEnum on android 4.1.2
data.body:
The line 

`GL.GetInteger((GetPName) GetParamName.MaxSamplesExt, out _maxMultiSampleCount);`

crashes my Xperia S 4.1.2 with InvalidEnum. Commenting it makes my game playable on 4.1 despite some sound issues.

data.title: Android: restoration of an activity fails after Game.Exit (v 3.6.0.1625)
data.body:
I pulled the sample game https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame.Samples/tree/develop/Platformer2D

Updated Monogame to the latest (3.6.0.1625) and suddenly I noticed the nasty effect if I click Back (calls `Game.Exit`) and then click app icon, it can't restore the game. It seems to work in "3.4.0.359"

That's what application output is showing:
```
[AppTracker] App Event: start
[MonoGame] MonoGameAndroidGameView.SurfaceCreated: surfaceFrame = Rect(0, 0 - 1920, 1080)
[MonoGame] GraphicsDeviceManager.ResetClientBounds: newClientBounds={X:0 Y:0 Width:1920 Height:1080}
[MonoGame] MonoGameAndroidGameView.SurfaceChanged: format = Rgb565, width = 1920, height = 1080
[MonoGame] GraphicsDeviceManager.ResetClientBounds: newClientBounds={X:0 Y:0 Width:1920 Height:1080}
[AppTracker] App Event: stop
[MonoGame] MonoGameAndroidGameView.SurfaceDestroyed
```

My Android is 7.1.1

data.title: iTunes Connect rejects Mac binary due to QTKit dependency
data.body:
My Mac App Store submission was rejected with the following response from iTunes Connect:

> **Deprecated API Usage** - Apple no longer accepts submissions of apps that use QuickTime or QTKit APIs.

I don't have any references to QuickTime in my project, so I assume this comes from a MonoGame dependency?

I'm using the MonoGame DesktopGL framework with native references to sdl2 and openal.

If this is a MonoGame issue, some guidance as to how to build a game that can pass the Mac App Store submission criteria would be appreciated.

Thanks!
-David

data.title: [Pipeline Tool] General Fixes + Cleanup
data.body:
Stuff done:
 - [Windows] Fixes menubar starting in top left corner
 - [Windows] Fixes redraw loop
 - [Mac] Fixes build output sizing problems
 - Removes unused style code

data.title: SharpDX.SharpDXException when loading SM4.0 (or higher) Effect with Reach-Profile
data.body:
It seems like the default GraphicsProfile is set to Reach now instead of HiDef. Which is fine, but because I didn't know this I tried to load an SM5.0-Effect with the Reach-Profile and got the following exception:

> SharpDX.SharpDXException: "HRESULT: [0x80070057], Module: [General], ApiCode: [E_INVALIDARG/Invalid > Arguments], Message: Falscher Parameter.
> 
> "

This exception is thrown in the "CreatePixelShader"-Function of the "Shader"-Class and because this exception isn't really helpful I think that:

- The Pipeline-Tool should throw an error if someone tries to compile an effect with SM4.0 (or higher) when the GraphicsProfile is set to Reach.
- MonoGame should throw an exception that tells the user to either use the HiDef-Profile or compile his effect with SM4.0-level 9.3

Hi
I have noticed since the build 313 that the tools displays incorrectly folders (Windows7 x64, I have no other OS to test with right now):

- Files in an expanded folder are not always indented in the folder (same vertical line as the containing folder) (1st screenshot: basicscene should be indented to appear in the "Scene" folder)

data.title: Add a new label for beginning contributors
data.body:
I've seen this on other projects on gihub and I think it could help encourage contribution to the project. At least that is the case for me.
I would be interested in contributing to MonoGame but since my C#-Skills are still a bit limited and so is my time. It would be helpful if I could more easily identify issues that require less knowledge of MonoGame.

A label like "beginner friedly" or "for beginners" could very much help with that. As it stands now I woud have to scan through all the issues (at least the ones with "help wanted") and then start looking at the corresponding postitions in the code. If I'm lucky I might find something that I feel comfortable working on, if I'm not I have to start that process over. And all of that takes some time.

Working in issues that require less initial knowledge could also help increase my knowledge of C# and MonoGame in general so over time it would be possible to tackle bigger problems. 

edit: I should propbably add that I'm not really used to working with labels myself, so if this is actually a thing with the people creating issues then it would be nice if use of such a label, where appropriate, would be encouraged.

data.title: SynchronizeWithVerticalRetrace does not work during game in OpenGL on Windows (ver. 3.6)
data.body:
I switch our project to version 3.6 of Monogame (OpenGL on Windows) and i found that GraphicsDeviceManager.SynchronizeWithVerticalRetrace does not work anymore.

It works just on Initialization state - there I can set SynchronizeWithVerticalRetrace successfully, but when I am trying switch synchronisation during the game - nothing happened. I am calling GraphicsDeviceManager.ApplyChanges() but it stay unchanged.

In old version 3.5 it works properly.
